get
examples:
<caption>Extend application object</caption>
var state = require('./plugins/redux.state');
var app = new Marionette.Application();
module.exports = Object.assign(app, state);

<caption>Enhanced getState accepts path parameter</caption>
app.getState();// {name: 'omaha-project', count: 42}
app.getState('count');// 42

<caption>Update state with Redux API</caption>
app.getState('count');// 42
app.dispatch({type: 'INCREMENT'});
app.getState('count');// 43

unknown.tagValue:
Features:
- Enhanced getState that accepts path parameter
- "dispatch logging" middleware
- Basic reducer showcasing how to leverage lodash for updating state

name: src/commands/add-marionette/templates/mn.renderer.shim.js

unknown.tagValue:
Shim Marionette template renderer to use morphdom
Other options include: inferno, snabbdom, rivets, idom and virtual-dom

name: src/commands/add-marionette/templates/mn.templates.shim.js
Marionette
description:
This shim replaces lodash template functions with Handlebars.js
(not needed if templates are pre-compiled)

unknown.tagValue: Component to display "under construction" warning for capabilities not yet implemented.
Used by ErrorBoundary component to display error message and data

properties.name: props.callback
properties.description: Function to be called after user interacts with warning

name: Task
examples: <Task text={'This task is done before it starts'} isComplete={true}></Task>

properties.name: props.isComplete
properties.description: Control display of check (true) or loading (false)

properties.name: props.isSkipped
properties.description: Control color of check - green (false) or dim (true)

name: TaskList
examples: <TaskList command={'add'} terms={'eslint'} options={{skipInstall: true}}></TaskList>

properties.name: props.terms
properties.description: Terms - eslint | babel | jest | postcss | docs

name: src/utils.js
someDoExist
description: Check that at least one file or files exist

return.description: Some files/path do exist (true) or all do not exist (false)

name: allDoNotExist
description: Check that all files do not exist

return.description: All files/paths do not exist (true) or some do (false)

name: format
description: Format input code using Prettier
examples:
<caption>Prettier options</caption>
{
    bracketSpacing: false,
    parser: 'json-stringify',
    printWidth: 80,
    tabWidth: 4,
    quotes: true
}

name: getIntendedInput
description: Use string-similarity module to determine closest matching string
examples: const [intendedCommand, intendedTerms] = getIntendedInput(commands, command, terms);

params.name: commands
params.description: Object with commands as key values, terms as key values for each command object

return.description: [intendedCommand, intendedTerms] Array destructed assignment is recommended (see example)

name: getVersions
description: Use npm CLI to return array of module versions
examples: const versions = getVersions('react');

name: install
description: Install dependencies with npm
examples:
<caption>Install production dependencies</caption>
install(['react']);

<caption>Install development dependencies</caption>
install(['jest', 'babel-jest'], {dev: true});

params.name: options.latest
params.description: If true, add "@latest" to all module names

name: verifyRustInstallation
description: Determine if system supports Rust (necessary Rust dependencies are installed)

name: BasicEditor
description: Base class to serve as base for JSON and module builder classes

params.name: shouldCommit
params.description: Whether or not the copy should be saved to disk (committed)

params.name: shouldCommit
params.description: Whether or not the copy should be saved to disk (committed)

name: createJsonEditor
description: Create and edit a JSON file with a fluent API

name: createModuleEditor
description: Create and edit a JS module with a fluent API

params.name: prependedContents
params.description: Content prepended to top of file

name: Scaffolder
description: Class to create scaffolders when creating folders, and copying files/templates

name: source
description: Set source directory

name: target
description: Set target directory

name: copy
description: Copy a file

params.name: path
params.description: Path string of file to be copied

name: commit
description: Write changes to disk

name: BabelConfigModuleEditor
description: Create and edit a Babel.js configuration file with a fluent API
examples:
<caption>Extend module.exports content and prepend text to the top of the file</caption>
const cfg = new BabelConfigModuleEditor();
await cfg
    .create()
    .extend({
        presets: [`'@babel/preset-env'`]
    })
    .prepend(`const {existsSync} = require('fs-extra');`)
    .commit();

name: EslintConfigModuleEditor
description: Create and edit an ESLint configuration file with a fluent API
examples:
const cfg = new EslintConfigModuleEditor();
await cfg.create().commit();

name: PackageJsonEditor
description: Create and edit a package.json manifest file with a fluent API
examples:
<caption>Create a new package.json</caption>
const pkg = new PackageJsonEditor();
await pkg.create().commit();

<caption>Create a new package.json and read its contents (chaining OK)</caption>
const pkg = new PackageJsonEditor();
const contents = pkg.create().read();

<caption>Extend a package.json</caption>
await pkg.extend({
    script: {
        test: 'jest --coverage'
    }
}).commit();

<caption>Create and extend a package.json without writing to disk (chaining OK)</caption>
const script = {
    lint: 'eslint index.js -c ./.eslintrc.js'
};
await pkg
    .create(false)
    .extend({script}, false)
    .commit();

name: PostcssConfigEditor
description: Create and edit an PostCSS configuration file with a fluent API
examples:
const cfg = new PostcssConfigEditor();
await cfg.create().commit();

content:
# tomo-cli [![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/travis/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli.svg?logo=travis&style=for-the-badge)](https://travis-ci.org/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli) [![codecov](https://img.shields.io/codecov/c/github/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli.svg?logo=codecov&style=for-the-badge)](https://codecov.io/gh/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli)

> A friendly command line tool designed to help create sustainable software using web technology

## Install

```
$ npm install --global tomo-cli
```


## Usage

```js
$ tomo --help

  Usage
    tomo [command] [term] [options]

  Options

    --source-directory, -d  Directory for source code [Default: ./src]
    --assets-directory,     Directory for assets [Default: ./assets]
    --use-react, -r         Add React support to workflow [Default: false]
    --react-version         React version for ESLint configuration [Default: '16.8']
    --ignore-warnings, -i   Ignore warning messages [Default: false]
    --skip-install, -s      Skip npm installations [Default: false]

  Examples
    $ tomo
```


## License

MIT © [Jason Wohlgemuth](http://omaha.js.org)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "tomo-cli",
    "version": "0.0.0",
    "description": "A friendly command line tool designed to help create sustainable software using web technology",
    "license": "MIT",
    "bin": {
        "tomo": "dist/index.js"
    },
    "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "git+https://github.com/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli.git"
    },
    "author": "Jason Wohlgemuth <jhwohlgemuth@gmail.com> (omaha.js.org)",
    "engines": {
        "node": ">=6"
    },
    "scripts": {
        "copy:assets": "cpy '**/*.(html|hbs|css)' '**/[.]*' '../dist/' --cwd=src --parents --recursive",
        "dev": "stmux [ \"npm run build:watch\" : \"npm run lint:watch\" ]",
        "prebuild": "npm run build:clean",
        "build": "babel src --out-dir dist --ignore __tests__",
        "postbuild": "npm run copy:assets",
        "build:clean": "rm -frd ./dist",
        "build:watch": "watch 'npm run build' ./src",
        "build:docs": "esdoc -c ./esdoc.conf.json",
        "test": "jest .*.test.js --coverage",
        "test:e2e": "jest .*.e2e.js",
        "test:watch": "npm test -- --watchAll",
        "open:coverage": "opn ./coverage/lcov-report/index.html",
        "open:docs": "opn ./docs/index.html",
        "lint": "eslint . -c ./.eslintrc.js --fix",
        "lint:watch": "watch 'npm run lint' ./src",
        "lint:tests": "eslint __tests__/**/*.js -c ./.eslintrc.js --fix --no-ignore",
        "lint:tests:watch": "watch 'npm run lint:tests' ./__tests__",
        "lint:config": "eslint -c ./.eslintrc.js *.js --fix",
        "lint:docs": "eslint src/*.js src/**/*.js --no-eslintrc --rule valid-jsdoc:error --parser babel-eslint",
        "lint:all": "npm-run-all lint lint:tests lint:docs",
        "predocs": "npm run lint:docs",
        "docs": "npm run build:docs",
        "postdocs": "npm run open:docs"
    },
    "jest": {
        "testMatch": [
            "**/__tests__/**/*.(e2e|test).[jt]s?(x)"
        ],
        "testPathIgnorePatterns": [
            "/__tests__/fixtures"
        ]
    },
    "keywords": [],
    "dependencies": {
        "chalk": "2.4.2",
        "delay": "4.2.0",
        "execa": "1.0.0",
        "figures": "3.0.0",
        "fs-extra": "7.0.1",
        "ink": "2.1.1",
        "ink-big-text": "1.0.1",
        "ink-box": "1.0.0",
        "ink-select-input": "3.1.0",
        "ink-spinner": "3.0.1",
        "lodash": "4.17.11",
        "mem-fs": "1.1.3",
        "mem-fs-editor": "5.1.0",
        "meow": "5.0.0",
        "p-queue": "5.0.0",
        "prettier": "1.17.0",
        "prop-types": "15.7.2",
        "react": "16.8.6",
        "some-module": "0.0.3",
        "string-similarity": "3.0.0",
        "update-notifier": "2.5.0",
        "xterm": "3.12.2"
    },
    "devDependencies": {
        "@babel/cli": "^7.4.3",
        "@babel/core": "^7.4.3",
        "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "7.4.0",
        "@babel/plugin-proposal-export-default-from": "7.2.0",
        "@babel/plugin-proposal-optional-chaining": "7.2.0",
        "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "7.4.3",
        "@babel/preset-env": "7.4.3",
        "@babel/preset-react": "7.0.0",
        "@babel/runtime": "^7.4.3",
        "babel-eslint": "10.0.1",
        "babel-jest": "24.7.1",
        "cpy-cli": "2.0.0",
        "directory-tree": "2.2.1",
        "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
        "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "esdoc-jsx-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "eslint": "5.16.0",
        "eslint-config-omaha-prime-grade": "11.0.0",
        "eslint-plugin-react": "7.12.4",
        "ink-testing-library": "1.0.1",
        "jest": "24.7.1",
        "npm-run-all": "4.1.5",
        "opn-cli": "4.1.0",
        "rimraf": "2.6.3",
        "stmux": "1.6.1",
        "watch": "1.0.2"
    },
    "bugs": {
        "url": "https://github.com/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli/issues"
    },
    "homepage": "https://github.com/jhwohlgemuth/tomo-cli#readme",
    "script": {
        "lint": "eslint . -c ./.eslintrc.js --fix",
        "lint:watch": "watch 'npm run lint' undefined",
        "lint:tests": "eslint __tests__/**/*.js -c ./.eslintrc.js --fix --no-ignore"
    }
}
name: package.json
